result.execSummary:
The defendant Elbert Wilson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING 4/8/2016 at 1:15 p.m. in Br. 38.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Any cash bail to be applied.

All costs, surcharges, etc. imposed in 15CM4053 to be paid during probation or civil judgment to be entered.

Provide DNA sample, pay costs of DNA surcharge.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdmeanor crime of domestic violence.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

No contact with the victim unless requested by victim and then only wit prior approval of agent or the Court.
No contact with firearms.
No new law violations.

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention or anger management and continue programming.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs a deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elbert Wilson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Elbert Wilson in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  AS to count 1:    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to 15CM4053, with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 45 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 4-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.  All costs, surcharges, etc imposed in 15CM4053 to be paid during probation or civil judgment to be entered.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED:  Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE FILE. Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Elbert Wilson not in court, in custody.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned in branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Elbert Wilson not in court, defendant in custody.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has 3 other cases pending.  Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 11-27-2015
Bench Warrant in file.  
Case is adjourned to 12-7-2015 at 8:15 
for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 18.
Notice is given to Public Defender's Office.  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Discharge Summary Report.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Violation Report from Justice Point, received and filed.
-- Missed Office Contact: 7-9-2015.   mld

Defendant Elbert Wilson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 8-6-2015 at 8:15 am.  Statement made by Virginia F.  EFFECTIVE AUGUST 3, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE HON. JEFFREY WAGNER, BRANCH 38, IN ROOM 504 OF THE COURTHOUSE.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Virginia F., no firearms in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-8-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Elbert Wilson Jr. in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-28-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Virginia F.

Defendant Elbert Wilson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Elbert Wilson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
